Greatest common divisor of a finite set

type:
{α : Type u_1} →
  {β : Type u_2} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [inst : NormalizedGCDMonoid α] → Finset β → (β → α) → α
name: Finset.gcd
docString: Greatest common divisor of a finite set

For every natural number `n`, the oddness of `n` and `n+1` are opposite.

type: ∀ (n : ℕ), n.succ.bodd = !n.bodd
name: Nat.bodd_succ
docString: For every natural number `n`, the oddness of `n` and `n+1` are opposite.

This theorem asserts that for every integer `d` and every solution `a` to the Pell equation `x^2 - d*y^2 = 1` (where x and y are elements of the set of integers, and d is non-zero), if the x-value of the solution `a` is greater than one, then `d` must be positive. In other words, if a solution to the Pell equation has its x-coordinate larger than 1, then the parameter `d` associated with that solution is guaranteed to be positive.

type: ∀ {d : ℤ} {a : Pell.Solution₁ d}, 1 < a.x → 0 < d
name: Pell.Solution₁.d_pos_of_one_lt_x
docString: This theorem asserts that for every integer `d` and every solution `a` to the Pell equation `x^2 - d*y^2 = 1` (where x and y are elements of the set of integers, and d is non-zero), if the x-value of the solution `a` is greater than one, then `d` must be positive. In other words, if a solution to the Pell equation has its x-coordinate larger than 1, then the parameter `d` associated with that solution is guaranteed to be positive.

The finset of those partitions in which every part is odd.

type: (n : ℕ) → Finset (Nat.Partition n)
name: Nat.Partition.odds
docString: The finset of those partitions in which every part is odd.

A natural number is odd if and only if it is not even, or equivalently, a natural number is odd if and only if it can be expressed as 2 times an integer plus one, while an even number can be expressed as the sum of two integers.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ}, Odd n ↔ ¬Even n
name: Nat.odd_iff_not_even
docString: A natural number is odd if and only if it is not even, or equivalently, a natural number is odd if and only if it can be expressed as 2 times an integer plus one, while an even number can be expressed as the sum of two integers.

The theorem `DihedralGroup.card_commute_odd` states that for any odd natural number `n`, the number of pairs of elements in the Dihedral group of order `2n` that commute (i.e., their multiplication is commutative) is equal to `n*(n+3)`. Here, an element `a` of a semiring is said to be odd if there exists an integer `k` such that `a = 2*k + 1`. Commutativity between two elements `a` and `b` means `a * b = b * a`. The Dihedral group of order `2n` is a mathematical construct used in group theory, a branch of abstract algebra.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ}, Odd n → Nat.card { p // Commute p.1 p.2 } = n * (n + 3)
name: DihedralGroup.card_commute_odd
docString: The theorem `DihedralGroup.card_commute_odd` states that for any odd natural number `n`, the number of pairs of elements in the Dihedral group of order `2n` that commute (i.e., their multiplication is commutative) is equal to `n*(n+3)`. Here, an element `a` of a semiring is said to be odd if there exists an integer `k` such that `a = 2*k + 1`. Commutativity between two elements `a` and `b` means `a * b = b * a`. The Dihedral group of order `2n` is a mathematical construct used in group theory, a branch of abstract algebra.

type: {α : Type u} → [inst : CompleteLattice α] → (α →o α) →o α
name: OrderHom.gfp
docString: Greatest fixed point of a monotone function

The finset of those partitions in which every part is odd and used at most once.

type: (n : ℕ) → Finset (Nat.Partition n)
name: Nat.Partition.oddDistincts
docString: The finset of those partitions in which every part is odd and used at most once.

If a solution has `x > 1`, then `d` is positive.

type: ∀ {d : ℤ} {a : Pell.Solution₁ d}, 1 < Pell.Solution₁.x a → 0 < d
name: Pell.Solution₁.d_pos_of_one_lt_x
docString: If a solution has `x > 1`, then `d` is positive.

If a fundamental solution exists, then `d` must be positive.

type: ∀ {d : ℤ} {a : Pell.Solution₁ d}, Pell.IsFundamental a → 0 < d
name: Pell.IsFundamental.d_pos
docString: If a fundamental solution exists, then `d` must be positive.

Infinitely many natural numbers are equal to `d` mod `n`.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ}, n ≠ 0 → ∀ (d : ℕ), ∃ᶠ (m : ℕ) in Filter.atTop, m ≡ d [MOD n]
name: Nat.frequently_modEq
docString: Infinitely many natural numbers are equal to `d` mod `n`.

Greatest common divisor of a multiset

type: {α : Type u_1} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [inst : NormalizedGCDMonoid α] → Multiset α → α
name: Multiset.gcd
docString: Greatest common divisor of a multiset

If `d` is positive and not a square, then a fundamental solution exists.

type: ∀ {d : ℤ}, 0 < d → ¬IsSquare d → ∃ a, Pell.IsFundamental a
name: Pell.IsFundamental.exists_of_not_isSquare
docString: If `d` is positive and not a square, then a fundamental solution exists.

`⊤` is the greatest element

type: ∀ {α : Type u} [self : BooleanAlgebra α] (a : α), a ≤ ⊤
name: BooleanAlgebra.le_top
docString: `⊤` is the greatest element

name: Zsqrtd.sqrtd

The degree-`n` power sum

type: (σ : Type u_1) → (R : Type u_2) → [inst : CommSemiring R] → [inst_1 : Fintype σ] → ℕ → MvPolynomial σ R
name: MvPolynomial.psum
docString: The degree-`n` power sum

A Dirichlet character is odd if its value at -1 is -1.

type: {S : Type} → [inst : CommRing S] → {m : ℕ} → DirichletCharacter S m → Prop
name: DirichletCharacter.Odd
docString: A Dirichlet character is odd if its value at -1 is -1.

The differential `d` satisfies that `d² = 0`.

type:
∀ {S : Type u_1} [inst : AddMonoidWithOne S] {C : Type u} [inst_1 : CategoryTheory.Category.{v, u} C]
  [inst_2 : CategoryTheory.Limits.HasZeroMorphisms C] [inst_3 : CategoryTheory.HasShift C S]
  (self : CategoryTheory.DifferentialObject S C),
  CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp self.d ((CategoryTheory.shiftFunctor C 1).map self.d) = 0
name: CategoryTheory.DifferentialObject.d_squared
docString: The differential `d` satisfies that `d² = 0`.

If `d` is a positive integer that is not a square, then there exists a nontrivial solution
to the Pell equation `x^2 - d*y^2 = 1`.

type: ∀ {d : ℤ}, 0 < d → ¬IsSquare d → ∃ a, a ≠ 1 ∧ a ≠ -1
name: Pell.Solution₁.exists_nontrivial_of_not_isSquare
docString:
If `d` is a positive integer that is not a square, then there exists a nontrivial solution
to the Pell equation `x^2 - d*y^2 = 1`.

The greatest common divisor between two elements.

type: {α : Type u_2} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [self : GCDMonoid α] → α → α → α
name: GCDMonoid.gcd
docString: The greatest common divisor between two elements.

name: iSup
docString: Indexed supremum

A natural number is odd iff it has residue `1` or `3` mod `4`

name: Nat.odd_mod_four_iff
docString: A natural number is odd iff it has residue `1` or `3` mod `4`

We can assume that a minimal solution to `a ^ 4 + b ^ 4 = c ^ 2` has `a` odd.

type: ∀ {a b c : ℤ}, Fermat42 a b c → ∃ a0 b0 c0, Fermat42.Minimal a0 b0 c0 ∧ a0 % 2 = 1
name: Fermat42.exists_odd_minimal
docString: We can assume that a minimal solution to `a ^ 4 + b ^ 4 = c ^ 2` has `a` odd.

If `d` is a positive integer that is not a square, then there is a nontrivial solution
to the Pell equation `x^2 - d*y^2 = 1`.

type: ∀ {d : ℤ}, 0 < d → ¬IsSquare d → ∃ x y, x ^ 2 - d * y ^ 2 = 1 ∧ y ≠ 0
name: Pell.exists_of_not_isSquare
docString:
If `d` is a positive integer that is not a square, then there is a nontrivial solution
to the Pell equation `x^2 - d*y^2 = 1`.
